Articles.Content:
**'Invasion'**

***- Military KSP Movie -***

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/dagxe74VpMI?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Here's an unblocked version if you're having trouble watching it: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tIKT8EIJGTI](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tIKT8EIJGTI)

'Invasion' is the opening of my Military series' second season: and a grand one at that. Some of the story won't make complete sense unless you're up to date with 

the series, which you can catch up on

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/O4kRXD2esn8?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
, but the action and thrill in this really is something I'm proud of and can be enjoyed regardless. 
It's also something that not many other cinematics have shown recently, 

I think good examples of it working elsewhere are SqueegyMackoy's 'Kerbal at War' videos.

This video is also a direct sequel to my previous cinematic 'Armageddon'. 

Which I recommend you watch first (think of this as a two parter).

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/yjH_iO-CPpM?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-06T06:39:14Z" title="05/06/2015 06:39  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 6, 2015</time> by HatBat**

Oh no! I don't have the time to watch this until I get home! I've watched Armageddon before and I'm excited for this next one too. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Oh no! I don't have the time to watch this until I get home! I've watched Armageddon before and I'm excited for this next one too. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Enjoy it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Welp, here we go! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Loving the crisp details and the cinematic quality.
